subject: Re: Problem using property files
msgSnippet: I found the problem, when I put the file in the package path it worked (com/iconversetest/jxweb/testdriver.properties). I changed the code to use classloader
messageBody:
I found the problem, when I put the file in the package path it
worked (com/iconversetest/jxweb/testdriver.properties).

I changed the code to use classloader and properties classes instead.

thanks.



--- In junit@y..., "kagerg" <kgerg@i...> wrote:
> I inherited a JUnit/JXUnit test application from a developer who
has
> gone back to school.
>
> He made some custom tags so it would suit our products particular
> test needs.
>
> I've recently added a new tag (rebuilt the qiml file) and in the
> class that the tag references I attempt to use a resource bundle so
I
> can dynamically grab a host name and port to build a url.
>
> I run the test through a batch script and set the classpath
> appropriately (i.e. %JAVA_HOME%\bin\java -verbose -cp %
ALL_CLASSPATH%
> junit.textui.TestRunner net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXTestCase)
>
> The resource bundle part isn't working (see stack trace below).
> Interestingly my new class is picked up fine. Has anyone ever
> encountered this problem before?
>
> Also, is there a better way to do this in the JUnit/JXUnit
framework?
>
> Thanks!
>
>
>
>
> C:\Work\BUILDTEST2
\SourceSafe\TestDriver\scripts\smart\gen\misc\Lang1
> (net.sou
> eforge.jxunit.JXTestCase)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: HTTP
> 404, file
> t found for url: http://localhost:8180/offline/ControlServlet.off?
> action=insta
> &g2sAPP=Lang1
> at com.iconversetest.jxweb.HttpRequest.eval
> (HttpRequest.java:127)
> at com.iconversetest.jxweb.AdaptixInstaller.eval
> (AdaptixInstaller.java:7
>
> at net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXDo.eval(JXDo.java:15)
> at net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXTestCase.runTest
> (JXTestCase.java:217)
>
> I print out the stack trace and I see this,
>
> java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name
> testdriver.p
> roperties, locale en_US
> at java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException
> (ResourceBundle
> .java:707)
> at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl
> (ResourceBundle.java:599)
> at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle
(ResourceBundle.java:554)
> at com.iconversetest.jxweb.AdaptixInstaller.eval
> (AdaptixInstaller.java:6
> 4)
> at net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXDo.eval(JXDo.java:15)
> at net.sourceforge.jxunit.JXTestCase.runTest
> (JXTestCase.java:217)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:140)
> at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected
> (TestResult.java:124)
> at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
> at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:131)
